H0.text: Brain is an organ in the structural organization of the central nervous system, which is part of the different levels of organization of the human body.

H1.text: Grey matter is the organ in the structural organization of the central nervous system.

H2.text: Nerve is an organ in the structural organization of the central nervous system within the human body's different levels of organization.

H3.text: Neuron is the organ in the structural organization of the central nervous system, according to the human body's different levels of organization.

A4.text: The brain is an organ that serves as the center of the nervous system in all vertebrate and most invertebrate animals.

A5.text: Neurons, however, are usually considered the most important cells in the brain.
